sentences.en: a song that is tender without being maudlin
sentences.cn: 一首温柔但不肉麻的歌

sentences.en: He always becomes maudlin after he's had a few drinks.
sentences.cn: 他喝了几杯酒后总是变得多愁善感.

sentences.en: He grew maudlin, could hardly see the cards or sit upright.
sentences.cn: 他变得沉醉了,不拘束了, 几乎看不清牌,也坐不端正了.

sentences.en: Jimmy turned maudlin after three drinks.
Mr. Carrey may be consciously steering his movies toward maudlin pop psychology.
sentences.cn: 金凯瑞也许有意将他的电影带往感情脆弱的大众心理学领域.

sentences.en: The company were in that maudlin mood when a little wit goes a great way.
sentences.cn: 这些人充满着伤感情调,一点点打趣的话也会使大家感到很愉快.

sentences.en: When scorned, they are very hurt and may overreact in an almost maudlin way.
sentences.cn: 当被嘲笑, 他们会非常受伤,可能以一种感情脆弱的方式反应过火.

words.tran_cn: 感情脆弱的；容易流泪的；酒后伤感的

trans.tran_en: If you describe someone as maudlin, you mean that they are being sad and sentimental in a foolish way, perhaps because of drinking alcohol
